node.title: The Melbourne man who took on the Catholic Church over historical sexual abuse and won
node.description: A Melbourne man has been awarded a record settlement by the Catholic Church of $3.7 million for historical sexual abuse, after the Archdiocese of Melbourne admitted a former Archbishop breached his duty of care.
node.content:
["Robert Friscic is a big bear of a man whose whole body shakes when he laughs, which he does a lot\u00a0when he gets nervous.", "There's also a childlike quality about him. A big part of him is still stuck in the 1980s\u00a0when, he says, his childhood was stolen from him by a local priest.", "But this underdog, with limited means and an intellectual disability, took on the Catholic Church and won.", "He lodged a civil claim in Victoria's Supreme Court, alleging abuse by Father Anthony Bongiorno.", "After two and a half years of litigation, the Archdiocese of Melbourne has offered an out-of-court settlement of $3 million.", "It has\u00a0admitted that former Archbishop Frank Little breached his duty of care.", "Mr Friscic's lawyers say the settlement, combined with previous payments, makes it the highest award for an historical abuse matter.", "
The warning signs
", "Mr Friscic\u00a0ran away from home in 1981 and sought refuge in the local Brunswick churchyard.\u00a0", "He was welcomed into the St Ambrose presbytery by Father Anthony Bongiorno.", "\"He [Father Bongiorno]\u00a0showed me where I\u00a0could have a shower in his bedroom \u2026\u00a0and he came in with me. And I didn't know right or wrong. [He]\u00a0started washing me all over my body,\"\u00a0Mr Friscic said.", "Mr Friscic\u00a0was 11 years old. The abuse continued until he was 18.", "", "
Robert Friscic sought refuge in the local Brunswick churchyard after running away from home as a child.(ABC News: Andrew Altree-Williams)
", "A number of social workers saw warning signs of sexual abuse and tried to raise the alarm.", "Roni Nettleton ran the boarding house where Mr Friscic was living. She confronted the priest when Mr Friscic kept disappearing at nights. She said Father Bongiorno just brushed it off.\u00a0", "\"[He said]\u00a0'Oh yes, he calls in you know, I'm supporting the family ... and he needs a father figure,'\" Ms Nettleton said.", "So she sought a meeting with the Archbishop at the time, Frank Little, but she didn't feel confident he'd follow it up.", "\"He more wanted to reassure us, that Father Bongiorno was very well respected in his parish \u2026\u00a0[Archbishop Little]\u00a0really had doubts about, you know, this sort of thing. 'Was this boy making this up?'\"", "Also in Mr Friscic's corner\u00a0was Victoria Police's Detective Sergeant\u00a0Sol Solomon, the informant in the criminal trial of Father Bongiorno.", "In 1996, the priest was tried for indecent assault and sexual penetration of three boys.", "", "
Father Anthony Bongiorno died in 2002.\u00a0(ABC)
", "Sergeant Solomon told the ABC's Trace podcast that Father Bongiorno was cold.", "Father Bongiorno was acquitted in two cases, and the third fell over. A devastated Mr Friscic took himself to the Westgate Bridge.", "\"I didn't want to live anymore, so I decided to go there and jump off,\" he said.", "And what stopped him?", "\"The police came.\"", "One of those police officers was Sergeant\u00a0Solomon, who Mr Friscic cries about now, remembering his kindness, before his trademark giggles roll back in to mask the pain.\u00a0", "
The case of Maria James\u00a0
", "For years, Mr Friscic took his anger out on the Church in unhealthy ways.", "\"I'd spray paint\u00a0the Catholic Church on their office \u2026\u00a0and send threatening emails. It was my way of getting them back,\" he told 7.30.", "However,\u00a0recently, he's channelled his grief into two separate legal matters: the civil action against Father Bongiorno, and a fresh coronial inquest, looking into the priest as person of interest in a 1980 cold case.", "Maria James was murdered in her Thornbury bookshop, and Father Bongiorno was seen soon after with blood on his hands and face.", "", "
Maria James's bookshop in Thornbury.\u00a0(Supplied: Victorian Coroner's Court. )
", "The ABC's Trace podcast revealed in 2017 that Ms James was set to confront the priest about the abuse of her younger son on\u00a0the day she was stabbed.", "Mr Friscic\u00a0testified this year at the new inquest into her death, saying he once asked the priest about the murder, and that Father Bongiorno went into shock at the question.", "\"I believe he did molest Maria's son and could have done anything to keep his secret \u2026\u00a0because he keeps secrets,\" Mr Friscic said.", "\"I was with him for 14 years, so I should know him.\"", "
Record settlement sets important precedent
", "Meanwhile, Mr Friscic's civil case dragged on.", "Then, a few days before the court hearing, the Archdiocese of Melbourne offered a settlement \u2014 $3\u00a0million, and a promise it wouldn't claw back the $700,000 it had earlier\u00a0offered Mr Friscic.", "His lawyer, Alessandra Pettit, said the win was four decades in the making.\u00a0", "", "
Alessandra Pettit represented Robert Friscic in his civil case against the Catholic Church.(ABC News: Greg Nelson)
", "\"Community service workers and or police officers \u2026\u00a0they tried to get his story told back in the 1980s. And they'd made reports,\" she said.", "As part of the case, a letter was tendered as evidence, written by a Melbourne primary school principal in 1980.", "The letter alleged Father Bongiorno was regularly having boys stay with him overnight at the presbytery, that he asked a boy to kiss him, and that all the primary school staff were worried about the priest's behaviour.\u00a0", "Despite learning of these allegations in 1980, former Archbishop Frank Little\u00a0went on to to appoint Father Bongiorno to two parishes\u00a0within the year.", "Father Bongiorno died in 2002.", "Jason Parkinson\u00a0from Porters Lawyers\u00a0says the settlement sets an important precedent.", "", "
Lawyer Jason Parkinson says suing the Catholic Church is like suing \"the great and powerful Wizard of Oz\".\u00a0(ABC News: Henry Zwartz)
", "\"Suing the Catholic Church is, little by little, like suing the great and powerful Wizard of Oz. There's lots of smoke and thunder, and disparity of power.", "\"But when Toto pulls the curtain back, it's just a humbug\u00a0who's pulling levers and turning dials\u00a0and scaring people.", "\"The Church does not like going to court because they're\u00a0treated like everyone else once they are\u00a0there \u2014 and that's how they should be treated.\"", "The Archdiocese of Melbourne declined to comment.\u00a0", "Now, Mr Friscic is just looking forward, thinking about moving into a new place and maybe getting a dog.", "\"Thank you to everyone who's stuck by me. Thank you family, because I've been a pest to them over the years;\u00a0Victoria Police, my support people \u2026\u00a0being around people\u00a0that care about me, [who are] trying to help me get better, that's what makes me happy.\""]
